Package PE2_F21

Class Note

java.lang.Object
PE2_F21.PerformingArt
PE2_F21.Note
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Art>, Art
class Note
extends PerformingArt
This is the Note class. It is known by three properties, the note, the duration in milisecond that the note is played, and the octave in which the note is played.
Author:
MAHFUZ RAHAMAN

  • Constructor Details

    • Note

      public Note()
      Default Constructor initialising the attributes to default values.

    • Note

      public Note​(int note, int duration, int octave)
      Overloaded constructor initialising values according to the input parameters.
      Parameters:
      note - is said to be valid if it is between the interval of [0,127].
      duration - is the duration of note in miliseconds. Can be any positive integer and it should not be a small duration, for example duration = 10 is too quick to let human hear the note.
      octave - sotres the octave of the note. It is valid if it is between the interval [-1,9].

  • Method Details

    • play

      public void play()
      This method plays a note in a specific octave with a certain duration. It validates the notes at first and may throw an excetion if the note is invalid. The exception is handled inside the method.
      Specified by:
      play in interface Art
      Specified by:
      play in class PerformingArt

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(Art art)
      This method compares two notes.
      Parameters:
      art - takes an input of an instance of Art. It is then casted to Note type. The method handles exception incase the input parameter is not of type Note.
      Returns:
      It returns an integer value. It returns 0 if notes are same. Returns 1 if note is higher than the input note and -1 otherwise.
